Works great doesn't disconnect like my brighouse modem
DO NOT BUY! For the price you're paying it's not worth all the trouble. Ours recently failed after less than a year.
Horrible product. My family lives in a 2500 sq ft home and our devices barely receive a faint signal in 50% of our house.

internet got faster after installing this and now save on our cable bill. Bought for most of my family as gifts to help them save money on thier bill. Paid for quickly with high rental fees for inferior equipment from cable company.
was not correct modem...

We replaced our modem Nov 2, 2016. On April 6, 2017 I called Comcast with steaming issues. My internet speed test was about half of what it should be. The Comcast rep told me my modem was at "end of life" status and wasn't supported any longer and suggested we replace it (with theirs, of course, at $9/month or so). They sent a signal and it still didn't fix it so I scheduled a service call. I then called Arris (and got right through to a PERSON, unlike Comcast) who informed me that my modem was NOT end of life, that this was the correct model number and that it is listed on Comcast's site as a recommended modem for people wanting to purchase their own. They call it end of life, because they don't lease out this model number any longer. He walked me through a few screens and all of a sudden my speed was faster than what ours is supposed to be at. The Arris rep thinks that their was noise on our line and it cleared after they resent the signal. He told me to keep retesting for speed and if it went back down to keep the Comcast appointment, otherwise I could probably cancel it. He was very helpful and polite. I could HEAR him clearly, unlike the Comcast rep, whom was using a headset that sounded like he was not talking into, even though I told him several times I couldn't hear him. I feel really good about Arris as a company and I would definitely recommend the company, along with this modem.
Great product and work veery well with my comcast
Great!
Constant issues with connection not working. We use high speed Comcast internet.

Bought this modem/router for my condo but it produced such a weak wifi signal that it could hardly go through the walls in the next room less than a foot away. While using the computer in the same room it produced an adequate signal at average speed.
Buy it used or at a reduced price. Not worth full price tag.
Not fully compatible with ISP system.
Plugged right in, worked instantly, and never looked back.
Exactly as described. Easy to set up and works well
Have had for about 8 months. Works great, have only had to reset maybe a couple times

products.name: Roku Ultra Streaming Media Player

detail.comments: This one is not as reliable as my Roku 3 on my other TV. Not sure if it is the Roku or my internet.
Everything is find except instructions

It's ok. I think the interface needs lots of work when trying to use PS Vue. I'm often required to register the device again. That's annoying but when considering the alternatives, but it's tolerable for now.

So I have been using the original Amazon Fire TV Sticks (2 of them) since they came out. I have 2 main uses for any such streaming device. I have a dedicated Plex server (i5-4430, 8GB RAM, 120GB SSD for OS, 16TB HDD 4x4TB, Windows Server 2012 r2 Essentials) so I need endpoints to play from and for streaming services like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Youtube, etc.
For a while the FTV sticks met my needs but over time I started noticing they got slower and slower...and they were not fast to begin with. It got to the point that the interface was slow to respond, I had constant issues with the Plex app crashing or saying my server was too slow to stream a given video, etc. Then I started to get choppy playback in streaming services like Amazon Prime and Netflix.
Ive got a great router (ASUS RT-AC88U) and internet (200mbps) and no other device on my network had these issues, Android phones, tablets, laptops, desktops. Also both fire sticks had the same problems escalating at the same time in the same way.
I considered getting a Fire TV (non stick) but was concerned I may be in for more of the same. Also I found the interface to be a bit less than ideal. Not that I can blame them, but the interface centers around Amazon content, not apps, and you have basically no control over the order of things in the interface.
I started to consider other options. The major, obvious competitor being Roku. I had heard good things and read up on it. They had all the apps I used including Amazon Prime, Plex, Netflix, and many others.
It then came to deciding which to get as they had refreshed the lineup and had many options. While I dont currently have a 4k TV I will likely upgrade in the near future and wanted something that could handle 4k, so that eliminated the Roku sticks. I also do not have the necessity to take the Roku on the go as I can hook up my phone or laptop for playback on the go. I wanted ethernet just in case so that left me between the premiere+ and the ultra.
The main reasons I chose the ultra over the premiere+ was the optical audio out, usb port, and voice search on the remote. I did however get a premiere+ to replace the second FTV stick in my bedroom about a week after using this. I intend to write a review on it, but if you do not need the 3 features I mentioned then the premiere+ will save you some money (I got it on sale here for $79).
The roku interface is simple, intuitive, and mostly uncluttered. Setup was a breeze. I was able to immediately find my way around and understand the settings and how to use it and so could my wife. Its app-centric and you have control over what order the apps are shown in. I was also impressed with the ability to remove some categories on the left like the "store" for movies and TV shows and news, further simplifying the interface.
Apps open almost instantly and I have yet to have an app crash. The settings are easy to work with. I added a 32GB Samsung Evo micro SD card to it and honestly I cant say if it improves much or not. Its likely overkill in terms of size (if not overall) but at $11 extra I figured might as well. I think the Roku just uses it as some sort of App cache, not storage in the traditional sense.
The voice search is ok but seems to lean more towards the major streaming services and pay to watch stuff. It may help for finding stuff in Netflix/Amazon Prime, but it doesn't work at all with Plex. Not a huge deal as I had pretty low expectations that it might.
The remote control built in audio jack for headphones is perfect. Volume is easily loud enough and audio quality is decent. The Android remote control app is very good and also offers the ability to do private listening. My only issue is that after about 10 mins the audio cuts out. I have a Pixel XL. I am not sure if its the app or the phone going into some sort of deep sleep or something but it renders the app useless for private listening, which is ashame because as nice as it works on the remote I am sure it will render the battery life on the remote pretty short.
I also finally convinced my wife to cut the cord and ditch cable TV. I havent watched live TV for years and between Plex, streaming, and cord cutting subscription services it didnt make sense to pay for cable any more. We were able to cut our bill down from $170/mo for internet (150mbps) and TV to ~$70/mo for 200mbps internet. We then subscribed to Sling TV's $40/mo top package which satisfied my wifes desire for some live TV content. Saves us a nice bit of money every month, its more flexible (watch on the go, watch when we want, etc) and other than maybe the internet charge dont have to worry about the cable company hiking prices.
All in all I am very impressed with the Roku's top offering. Now I know someone will inevitably point out I have compared a $40 device against a device that costs nearly 3x as much and your right, because thats what I have to base my observations on. However, if I had the chance to sit down with both and compare them side by side before purchasing either, I would gladly pay the 3x as much for the much better experience. I have no doubt that comparing the Roku premiere+ or ultra to the Fire TV non-stick id make the same assertion.
If you want to cut the cord, have a plex server, or even just heavily watch a select few streaming services heavily and your current device/smart TV doesnt handle them well then I highly recommend the Roku.
Be aware - it doesn't come with even a short HDMI cable (and is useless without one). I wish they would make these sort of things more clear.

I went through FOUR Amazon Fire TV boxes, 2 refurbished and 2 new, only one of them lasting nearly a month, the other three failing after no more than 2-3 days, and could not get an Amazon Fire TV Stick to last more than a month. This may have been due to some unknown incompatibility issues with my Samsung UN55KU6300 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2016 Model) but whatever it was it was extremely frustrating and a waste of my time and money.
So far the Roku Ultra is working solidly. I like the interface and what's available although I do miss the Kodi add-on that the Fire TVs could load. The Roku is faster than the Fire TV devices and although it's hard to tell, the picture quality appears to be a bit better too.

Up and running with no problems so far. No disconnects or syncing going on at this time. Here's the cable I bought to use with the device. I wanted to make sure I had a comparable 4k cable. Also, I am connected directly to a Ethernet connection verses using my wireless. My ISP is 30MBS.
MINC HDMI Cable 6 Feet -HDMI 2.0 Ready -26AWG,CL3 -Supports 4K 3D HDCP 2.2 and ARC with Ethernet -24K Gold Plated Connector
Sold by: MINC cable.
I watched a couple of shows in UHD and they looked pretty darnn good. My only complaint, wasn't with the product but with NETFLIX. When listing programs, I didn't see a listing to whether the program was UHD. I think they were definitely listed using the smart TV function.
Good 4K HDR UHD (4K) Streaming Device. Amazon and Netflix content in 4K with HDR (must have HDR TV).

My history is that I have been a DIE HARD WD TV Live Plus user for many years and delayed switched to Roku for the longest time because of its lack of ability to play back all file types, specifically .mkv files, but with the release of the Roku 4 and the addition of a Plex media server to my life, I will never look back! I LOVE my Roku 4, but we just moved into a new house that has a dedicated theater room and needed a second Roku to stream content to that room in addition to the TV we have on another floor, so I bought the Roku Ultra so I could compare the two. Since we spent a lot of good money on a new Epson Home Cinema projector and Yamaha receiver, I wanted to be getting the most out of my streaming device.
So far the Roku Ultra has been great, though I wouldn't say it's been any better than our 4 has been. We use it primarily to stream content stored on a dedicated media server that I built out of an old computer. Basically I installed a 4TB WD blue hard drive to hold all my media in addition to the 1TB drive that runs the operating system and software. I connected it to my network and have it running all the time. It has no monitor or keyboard because I use Google remote desktop to run updates, make changes and add content when I need to. Anyway, that's another story. Between Plex, Amazon Prime, YouTube and Netflix, that's basically our Roku use in a nutshell, but we stream to multiple devices at a time in 1080p. We had trouble with glitchy streaming when we first bought our Roku 4 but I soon discovered it was because we needed a newer, better router, not because of any problem with the Roku. I upgraded to an awesome dual channel Asus router and use the 5Ghz channel exclusively for media streaming. Ever since then we have been GOLDEN!
As for the differences between the 4 and the Ultra, here's what I can tell you. The Ultra is significantly smaller which is great for those with very limited real estate on their entertainment centers but this wasn't an issue for me so the new smaller size really makes no difference. It's exactly the same in its thickness. See my pictures for side by side comparisons of the unit and remote of the 4 and the Ultra. The Ultra does seem to run a little cooler than the 4 but again, I never had problems with over heating with my 4. I have not noticed any difference in noise level between the two at all. The remote is a little different in a way that takes some getting used to if you've been using a 4. The main "OK" button on the Ultra is in the center of the arrows whereas on the 4 is was right underneath the arrows. If you're used to using a 4 remote, you'll end up hitting the search button a hundred times on the Ultra remote until you get used to the new layout. That's not a big issue but is a little annoying to me because we still use our 4, so we have to switch back and forth in our brains. Also, the Roku Ultra takes a completely different kind of power cable than the 4 does. The only reason I noticed this is because when the Ultra arrived, I went to swap it out with the 4 and thought I'd use the 4's power cable for the Ultra because I had already painstaking threaded it down through the holes and plugged it into the power source in our home theater stack. Alas, it does not fit in the Ultra's hole. Again, this isn't a problem since it comes with the right power cord for it's needs, but if continuity is your thing, be aware of these changes. Otherwise, the Ultra behaves in every way like the 4 does, which honestly I'm very happy about because I love my 4! If I had to buy again, I'd probably just buy a second 4 instead of the Ultra because for the price, it really does pretty much the same job.
My biggest complaint isn't about the Ultra itself but about all Roku devices that I keep hoping they will change with every new release, and that is parental controls. Roku absolutely, positively SUCKS at parental controls! GET WITH THE PROGRAM ROKU!!!
That being said, I'm definitely happy with the Ultra so far and can highly recommend it if you want your streaming device to be as small and as cool as possible. I bought this unit refurbished to save $20-30 and I'm glad I did. It came looking and working like new! For the record, I did not receive this for free or at a discount. Hope this helps!
Roku wont let you down, and you can see the difference from the Roku 2 I upgraded from.

I would start by going to Roku's forum and read some threads there. You will see there are lots of people have the same issues I described below. Stay away from Roku. Very poor customer service, no audio, loud popping chirping, HDCP 2.2 errors, and no communication on a fix. In the forum there are threads of the problems described below going back to January 2017, 4 months and no update or communication of an update. My experience is below.
I have/had a Roku 4 that displayed 4k content and had no issues with the sound, it worked great. Then I got an email promotion to get the Ultra at a discount because I already had a Roku 4. Great, I will move the 4 to the bedroom and put the ultra in the living room. But when I go to watch any movie on Vudu with the Ultra that is DD+ 7.1 I have no sound. The latest example would be Star Wars Rouge One, no sound when playing HDX DD+ 7.1. If I switch it to SD, which is DD+ 5.1 it works fine. On top of having no sound for some movies, I am also getting a loud chirping/popping every 10-15 minutes or so on all content. I am also getting HDCP 2.2 error sometimes when watching 4k movies. Again, the Roku 4 never had any of these issues with the same exact setup. I know what you are thinking, just move the Roku Ultra to the bedroom and the Roku 4 to the living room. Well the Roku 4 will no longer turn on and when I called about it I was told it was 2 weeks out of warranty, too bad, buy a new one. Very poor customer service and not very happy about that either but that is an entirely different issue. I was on the phone for 50 minutes last night with tech support and they gave me a case number (that I forgot at home so I don’t have it) and was told somebody else would call me back to help. Well no phone call. They had me unplug and plug in the Roku Ultra and the TV, didn’t work. Go through the settings on the Roku Ultra, didn’t work. Remove the Vudu channel and add it, didn’t work. Switch HDMI cables and HDMI ports on the TV, didn’t work. I went as far as to hook up the Roku Ultra directly to the receiver with an optical cable on the second optical input so it wouldn’t go through the TV, didn’t work. All the HDMI cables I have are rated for high speed 4k content. I have the Roku Ultra wired directly to my modem and is a 60 Mbps I am at the point now where I wish I never bought the Roku Ultra and I wish my Roku 4 still turned on. I am very, very disappointed in Roku and I don’t think I would recommend any Roku products to anybody.

Solid unit, the remote is not as robust however as previous versions, dropped once and back snapped off, plastic is much cheaper. The unit itself is a good performer, same old interface but its functional and works fine. The HDMI audio is much lower than the Roku 3 it replaced, see Redit forums for others feeding back the same.
Great

Nothing but audio issues! Just Google "Roku Ultra - Audio Popping and Clicking" and click on the first result. This is a Roku support forum where MANY customers have expressed issues with Roku Ultra audio experiencing digital chirping, popping or clicking. I have reached out to Roku several times with VERY poor support. Every time I call, the agent goes through the regular support steps and are never aware of the issue. It's not until I get the manager on the phone and have them look at the forum, that they understand what I'm calling about.
The audio issue happens with all the channels I use at a frequency of every 10-15 minutes and as little as 2 minutes in between.
My device is up-to-date. I'm not using an audio-video receiver. The Roku Ultra is plugged directly into the VIZIO Model #E50u-D2 Display via HDMI and the Display is plugged directly into the Vizio Model #SB4551-D5 Sound Bar via HDMI-ARC.
I've tried all the trouble shooting there is. Reset to factory default. Delete and reinstall the channel. Check internet speed (I have the Roku hard wired and get around 260Mbps down/up). Make sure night audio mode isn't on. Try different audio out types (auto, Dolby Digital, Dolby Digital Plus, DTS). Switching to a different HDMI input on the display. Using a different HDMI cable. Chromecast works without issue. Apple TV works without issue. ROKU HAS ISSUES!
I've asked Roku to do a recall or voluntary return and they don't care. I wish I had never purchased the Roku and I would NEVER recommend a friend get one. Get an Amazon Fire TV, Apple TV or some other device, NOT A ROKU!

Excellent for what it it supposed o do. We have cut our cable cord and this fits the bill perfectly. I would say once every few days it has to reboot so there is a memory leak somewhere and the UI could use alot of work to make it easier to find content. PS VUE UI on this needs a lot of work.

UPDATE 4/4/2017:
After a lot of research, I found out that the Angry Birds Game license with ROKU has expired and this game is only found on the original Roku 2XS models now. After further research, I found that I can add a vanity code and PURCHASE Angry Birds Rio and Angry Birds Seasons for $4.99 each. Which I did today. However, these 2 Angry Birds games I purchased (like others I have bought) only show up on my ROKU 2 XS's and not on my Roku Premier + or my Roku Ultra. Very frustrating because the past games I have purchased for my Roku 2XS's all show up on the new Roku Models, but not the Angry Birds Rio or Angry Birds Seasons. **knocking off another star!**
-----
I own 4 Roku 2XS (since 2013) and they've worked great up until Dec. 2016, when now watching a video via Amazon Prime or Youtube or SlingTV, they all now RE-BOOT within 60 minutes when they never had a problem prior to Dec 2016. No fix for this strange problem and it coincidentally seems maybe Roku is forcing us to buy the NEWER models? Regardless, I plunged in and bought 2 replacements for 2 of my Roku 2 XS's.
One the Roku Premier+ and the other a Roku Ultra via Amazon. Both work great (so far) while watching movies for over 60 minutes, but my only BIG GRIPE is they have taken away the basic ANGRY BIRDS GAME (offered free with the ROKU 2XS) It is not offered free or for purchase at all on the newer ROKU Models! Sure they have the other games we've purchased with the Roku 2XS's now brought over to my new ROKU models as well as some other games for free and for purchase, but my problem is the NEW ROKU MODELS are missing the ANGRY BIRDS GAME. It is just not there for us now. The NEW ROKU models are very capable of handling the basic Angry Birds Game. So why isn't it offered?
My one 13 yr old twin son has Autism. HE LOVES this game! He plays it alone, and the best part is that he PLAYS WITH OTHER FAMILY MEMBERS with this awesome game. I've messaged ROKU via Facebook how this very simple fun family game should be brought back to the NEWER ROKU Models. If the old Roku 2XS's can handle the Angry Birds game, certainly the new Roku Models can.
I can't post my petition link on this issue here with my Amazon review, but maybe others out there can contact ROKU about bringing the Angry Birds Game back to the new ROKU models via email, twitter, or FB on this issue that would be great!
If Roku brings back this FUN FAMILY GAME (even if I have to purchase it) , I will raise my rating stars to 5.

I have been using Roku's for years. I have 3 Roku 3's on all my other TV's. I upgraded living room a 4K TV and naturally went with this Roku Ultra. It did not work as I had hoped. Now I very well could have had a bad unit and a replacement maybe would have worked as advertised. However, during the troubleshooting process I came across the new Nvidia Shield TV and wow, I was missing out big time. I returned the Roku Ultra. It just seems like there are still bugs that need to be worked out with the device and how it plays very high quality content. Still love Roku as a service but they need better quality control.

Streaming 4K Movies through Roku VUDU are great and there is little risk they won't default to 1080P (HDX). Same movies through Samsung 4K Bluray (8500) may play just HDX.
Roku streams through a Yamaha receiver. Roku needs to be rebooted (power off 10 secs then on) more often than I like (after freezing or a "lack of bandwidth" error . . . 50 MPS bandwidth connection) but I would buy it again.
Universal all in one remote produces multiple clicks on Roku if button push is even a little too long. Frustrating. I use the cell app remote rather than the Roku remote. Works great and always with me.

Spent big bucks on this and the sound and video are out of sync. It took me too long to troubleshoot the problem. It's the Roku device itself, I put a stick in its place and works fine. The high dollar one is a piece of crap. One star is too many

Before investing in a 4K TV, I decided to upgrade my streaming player for my 55-inch, 1080p set, so I took a chance on the Ultra. Several weeks of joy so far. Nice ride.
Visual/audio quality greatly surpass the streaming apps in my several-year-old smart TV and my TiVo Roamio player (which I had already thought were good)). Netflix looks subjectively like Blu-ray and the optical audio (I'm using for an older AVR receiver) delivers superb 5.1 support.
This is my second Roku so I basically knew what to expect for set-up, including: make sure your network components are spec'd well for streaming and that your ISP delivers clean, steady data. (Avoid "garbage in, garbage out.") Here, I've got clean local network components and a 40 Mbps stream from ISP which are working pretty flawlessly.
I've been luckier than some buyers who report big problems. I wonder how much impact the local home network has on overall performance for some dissatisfied buyers. (Don't get angry with me for asking; I certainly had a steep learning curve with my original Roku and remember having to upgrade my modem, router, ethernet cables, tweak my DNS providers, and even switch from one ISP to another, before I got my best results with my first Roku in 2009. Everyone's experience can differ but remember, it's a network appliance, and performance relies on such dependencies.)
There's a wide variety of Roku channels - some are great, some are schlock, others require a cable TV subscription (which I lack). It's fun to check for new ones but mostly this "cord-cutter" is watching Netflix, Amazon, YouTube (plus whatever my TV antenna brings in). This provides more content than I can keep up with, actually.
Frustrated I couldn't teach Ultra commands to a universal remote (forum users complain of this: commands come out as double clicking when taught to some remotes). Then I found the inexpensive Harmony 650 has a profile for Ultra, which solved that. Also frustrated with periodic loud audio pops (again, forum users complain). Roku needs to post firmware fixes soon if they want enthusiastic mass buy-in.
Your mileage may vary, but I'm having a great time so far with this gorgeous player and hope you do, too.
Great product and quick delivery.

We recently bought a 55" 4K TV and got the Ultra to replace our Roku 3. Bumped up our Netflix subscription to 4K. We enjoy the Ultra as much as we have the Roku 3. The only problem we've had is that the remote occasionally unpairs itself, but it's a simple thing to get it re-paired. The Ultra connects to our home's 5GHz network with no problems.
Lightning fast, great quality. Number 1 streaming device.

After only 2 months the remote has died and support is telling me I have to pay $30 for a new one. WTF! I can't return it to Amazon and Roku wont replace it because I didn't buy it from them. Not happy.
This thing is a MUST for cord-cutters with internet.

I was looking to cut the cable and save some money and I believe that I can say it's going to be a breeze with this unit! Install was quick and easy and that's an understatement. I've been tinkering with electronic devices for over 40 years and rarely has any device ever installed and set up as easily on the first attempt as this roku device. The video and audio is crisp and clear, no pixelation, stutter, or audio problems. I highly recommend this unit (I currently have sling tv with att internet through my av receiver/7.1 surround).
Same Day Delivery!! Excellent!!
It's up to 4k, and a Roku. Best streaming player I've tried.

We all look at the reviews and you will see a few negative ones. I had issues with my new 4K Roku. It was turning on and off. I saw the same problem listed in the negative reviews. I wanted to point out that I was having that problem when l had my 4K Roku hooked up to my 1080 TV. Once I hooked it up to my new 4K TV, the entire problem went away. After two hours of total frustration, I learned that despite the quick setup instructions, details printed on the ID card, and downloading the online manual, this particular router did not use 192.168.0.1. Every attempt to login with that address caused the guts in my Netgear cable modem/router to ask for Netgear Genie credentials. Using http://dlinkrouter.local./ had google sending me to a website with an emulator of the login screen. After mucho scratching and digging, I found that this router identifies itself as 192.168.100.1 Once I stumbled on that, everything went smoothly and it's a strong and powerful router. I know there are lot of reviews and questions, and I may have the only 859 that has this boogled-up address scheme, but if you get nowhere with 0.1, try 100.1
And, of course, everything in system that was not DHCP had to have the ip addresses changed to reflect the 100 instead of 0. That's why 1 star. Otherwise, a nice router.

detail.comments: works just fine. saves me the $10 comcast rental fee every month. pays for itself in just 8 months.

This is a very good modem - very fast, well built and thought out. It is a later rev to the Arris version and this motorola has a power switch. I feel the case is better ventilated as well. I have cox communications and I am on their premier plan at 300/30. I regularly see 350 / 50 with this modem! HUGE step up from my old 4x4 surfboard which could barely squeak out 130ish down.
Now for the single issue I have had. I also posted this on the egg for others to find:
I have had the modem about 2 months maybe. In the last few weeks I started to see random lost connections. Movies / games or whatever would suddenly drop and I would see on my router that internet connection was lost. Modem still had all lights on and all looked OK but clearly was not.
So with that, I started to troubleshoot. From experience, I always look at the cheap wall wart power supplies all manufacturers seem to supply with their products (manufacturers, I would seriously pay extra if you advertised a top notch supply with your products!). Glad I started here first - upon testing without load, the 12V supply was only putting out 9V. Under load it would dip under 9V into the 8.5 range. In short, the PSU is done. Since finding this, I hooked the modem to a lab grade linear in my office and all seems stable, I am not seeing any drop off as of yet so the drop out does not appear to be the modem itself - the dirt cheap power supply seems to be the cause. So, I have ordered in a replacement power supply from a very reputable company named MeanWell. They make about the best affordable smps supplies around. The model I put on order in case anyone else has this issue is GST25A12-P1J. This is a 2A rated 12V supply and should plug directly into the modem without modification as the modem appears to have a 2.1mm x 5.5 barrel connector input. The modem states on the label it requires a 12v 1a supply. I prefer headroom on any power supply so the 2A version was a perfect option.
I also had to buy a much larger version for my linksys wrt1900ac router as its power supply flat out failed (it happens with cheap switching supplies). Most will discard a device when it stops working - always check the power supply as the fix may only cost less than $20! To note, the one used on my linksys router was a GST60A12-P1J which is a 5A rated 12V supply.
Hope this helps some of you! If I can update this review later with a more long term test, I will do so.

Last 13 Days, would not go faster than 30mbs, from 230mbs after 13 days. Smelled burnt, ethernet would not work with pc, router only. Had a Xfinity tech at my house for 2 hours, all other variable were ruled out. Plugged in old modem, no more speed issue.
Seems to work well.

I've had this for about a month now. I came close to returning it for another modem. The reason is that I'm not getting a consistent speed along with the advertised speed I purchased from my ISP, that is Comcast.
I have blast internet, 150mbps, and in the beginning I was amazed I was getting more than what I was getting, around 200+Mbps... This was also at around 2am in the morning. I wake up and tested it again in the afternoon, it was a paltry 8-15mbps with a higher upload of around 11mbps.
Like every regular individual who has dealt with different ISP, I rebooted the modem and the wifi and waited. So after it was done it was surprisingly fast again in the 100s. Not the full consistent 150mbps that I paid for, but I've learned to be sadly complacent since Comcast has a monopoly on being the only high speed provider in my neighborhood. However, after 30 minutes to an hour or so it was in the low end again, around 10-20mbps.
I have called Comcast twice. Both customer service were both wonderful and tried to help me to what they are able to do in the company. First one did a check on my speed and realized it was low so he scheduled someone to come look at it the next day. While I was at work I get a call from another Comcast rep who was trying to fix it through the routine reboot and wait. This guy was annoying. I told him I'm at work I can check my wifi from work fortunately through Google WiFi but I can't reset. I told him I'll call back and cancel the scheduled visit if I can do something on my end. Got home rebooted it near midnight was high speed again, and cancelled the visit thinking I'll see for a week what happens.
Same thing happens and it's mostly random. I'm thinking it's basically when there's high traffic in my neighborhood or my modem keeps getting a mdds something error connection and I reboot it.
There is that glorious day when I reboot it and the speed is consistent for a while day. Rare.
Second time I called Comcast, it's a rep that's outsourced when though I called in the afternoon. Good guy but couldn't help me much like check my speed because he's limited in what to work with. Basically just said reboot it etc but the line seems solid from his end and that I should call the manufacturer.
So like every person who's had it, I've just been resetting my modem whenever it's slow. And if it's still slow I just think it's high traffic. If after the reset it's fast again, I think my connection somehow got screwed up.
I was thinking of getting another modem, one that doesn't need to be rebooted all the time when slow, but I figured the modem is consistently connected to the internet, it's just the speed that varies. So I keep it and do my resets.
That's my experience. Good luck. Also the US should be getting 1gbps gigabyte per second by the way, like the rest of the developed countries. We're very behind because of the big monopolies in the us with our isps. Only Google is trying to spread the 1gbps speed but the rest of the companies like Comcast and Verizon are fighting them. So annoying.

Works fine as a cable "modem", though I consider it a gateway since it translates baseband Ethernet to broadband Ethernet over coax. It obtains one IP (WAN) and has one IP (LAN): 192.168.100.1. I plugged in a laptop Ethernet RJ-45 configured for DHCP for everything and was able to connect to it, port 80, to configure it. That said, I don't see any place in it for configuring a DHCP server. I plugged in the "Internet" port of a Netgear AC1750 to it (owned for 3+ years), and use the Netgear for my DHCP server; its configuration web server sits on 192.168.0.1 and I don't have any problems using 192.168.0.x for all my home hosts while being able to also see 192.168.100.1 and, of course, Internet-based hosts. I don't have to program the Netgear to route through the MB7420; it knows that's the default route. The MB7420 then NATs to a 10.x.x.x IP that Charter assigns me (if I recall correctly). The MB7420 is also capable of getting one IPv6 IP, but mine shows as blank.
It has 16 downlink channels, 4 uplink. It gives freqs, channel numbers, dbmV, S/N ratio, and corr and uncorr errors for each freq., and it gives one log for all your ranging problems. Currently the software has reboot capability, but Charter took that feature out of my old Motorola box several months ago so they may do that again for this one.
It's passively cooled. The heatsink is close to the top of the box, and the box has plenty of holes in it to allow airflow (in via sides, out via top).
Nice and Simple

Works perfectly with comcast/xfinity. Even has an xfinity logo on the box. After initial setup I noticed I wasn't getting the speeds I should be. I contacted xfinity support, they upgraded the boot config file and it's running full speed now.

products.name: Zoom 8x4 Cable Modem, 343 Mbps DOCSIS 3.0, Model 5345, Certified by Comcast XFINITY, Charter Spectrum, Time Warner Cable and Other Service Providers

detail.comments: Bought this and a TPLink router to replace a Motorola modem/router combo due it's continued dropping of our WiFi. This thing is great. We use Spectrum high speed and it handles it just fine.
Has been working very well.
Nice modem. I'm actually getting speeds close to what the cable company advertises AND I'm free of having to pay a $10/month lease fee on a modem worth no more than $25.

I wasn't happy with my Internet speed and connection when using my Comcast rented router/modem combo. Hot a great deal on an Asus router and used my Comcast in bridge mode, faster but still not great. I researched for a low cost but great modem and landed on this little Zoom modem and I'm so happy. I'm getting 30% more speed just from changing to this modem.
Easy setup with comcast. Plugged it in and it did the rest, I was very happy that I did not have to call comcast for setup. Paying for 100 mps and Getting 110mps on my speed tests.
Worked perfectly with Comcast. No issues since I've had it.
good
Low price and works well with Comcast!
works perfect. Bought it for Comcast and i get even higher speeds with this modem than i did with their high end one.

Broke up my triple play and went with Sling TV (via Roku) but I stayed with my 15mb Internet feed from my ISP using an Arris Docsis 2 modem.
But my streaming sports & movies were choking.
I installed a passive network tap and hooked up my sniffer which showed excessive buffering at a regular pace.
I had my ISP come in to check out my 15mb service which, according to him, was perfect (why did I bother) and I showed him my captures of excessive buffering. He admitted he didn't understand my captures (good) but suggested I get a new DOCSIS 3 cable modem.
I was skeptical so I bought this modem because it was the cheapest ISP approved modem.
My buffering problem went away.
Hasn't come back since I bought this DOCSIS 3 modem
ALSO. My Internet phone calls (an Obihai 110 box) in addition to the choking TV were breaking up with the Arris 2.0 and that went away also with this new Zoom modem.
In fact, my router was set for "automatic shaping" for QOS but I set it to a dedicated 512k up signal for voice and now no problems with voice (SIP).
I've found that a 15mb Cable feed works with Sling TV alone but if I try to surf and stream music while watching TV my streamimg TV signal degrades. Streaming TV and talking on my internet phone is ok.
Hope this helps.
Was not want it appeared to be online.
Purchased two for houses with cable internet and Apple products. Work well...rapid constant flashing light might distract the sensitive.
Have had zero problems, super compatible with our Time Warner
Plain and simple. Sometimes the geek in me likes access to all kinds of options, but this doesn't need it. Plug it in and it works. Period.

This works better than the one supplied by my internet provider. I have a 60 Mbps plan and this passes through about 62 to 64 Mbps. It is also about 1/2 the size of the modem from my provider. This sits upright with no slots to mount onto the wall. I would have liked a bracket to fix it in place.

I am using this modem with Comcast-Xfinity. It has been working flawlessly for the past 6 months, during which I would have already paid more that this modem's cost if I had rented the modem they provide.
I prefer having my own wifi router and modem rather than using the ones rented from my ISP, regardless of the cost. I have complete control over my equipment to prevent outsiders from being able to access private information stored on my computers. When using equipment rented from your ISP, you have no way of knowing what backdoors they have that employees could use to access your devices attached to your home network.

Free from comcast modem/router at last, thank you Zoom!!
Oh yeah, connected with Google WiFi no problem :)
Great product, well worth the $$$$
Reliably replaces my $10/month cable company modem. Simple to put to use.
....and then it died, of course a month past the return date. Waste of money.
I would give this 5 stars if the lights were not so bright and blinking. I had to hide it inside an armoire.
Setup was easy, just had to call the cable company to verify. Great speed
Good
Works great with Time Warner cable internet. Just bought an apartment and decided to buy this instead of rent. Will save money within the year vs renting their equipment.
no issues at all works well with comcast. saved me a ton of money on rental fees

Im not one of these people on here thats giving it a low review because this modem, not a gateway, doesnt have wifi lol.
Verified model with my ISP Wide Open West. 1st month was good, 2nd month i noticed drop outs. Reseting did nothing. I blamed the ISP at one point but decided to use logical deductions.
Last night my internet went out for 11 hours. When my ISP opened, i picked up a rental to verify it was my modem and not the ISP. Sure enough, it was the modem. Now im outside the return window. I had a 5 year old motorala surfboard before it died. I expected more than 45 days. I do not recommend, but rather a surfboard even if Arris dawns the model now for 15 dollars more. Especially if you are a cord cutter like me with no cable. Don't make my mistake. Take the volume of reviews between the models as an indicator of what's known to be good.
Works well.
be careful this thing gets hot and you have to turn it off every few days or youll lose internet- but for the price? it pays for itself the first 3 months
plugged it in and it worked flawlessly. no complaints

Very fast performance at a reasonable price. I am not taking advantage of the modem's full capability, as I am only paying for the 10mbs speed with Comcast. This modem has the ability to outperform any speed I could purchase from Comcast right now, so I future-proofed myself in case I feel the need to increase my speed from them.

products.name: Motorola 16x4 High-Speed Cable Gateway with Wi-Fi, 686 Mbps DOCSIS 3.0 Modem, AC1900 Wi-Fi Gigabit Router and Power Boost

detail.comments:
I bought this to replace a Netgear N450 being used with Spectrum, formerly Time Warner. I was having problems with my wifi connection constantly dropping and inconsistent connection speeds in general. I thought it was possible that it was my ISP, but figured trying a new modem would be my first check. This one completely resolved my issues. With the Netgear unit, my speed would vary from an at best 50 Mbps down to a common 5-10 Mbps. In addition, the wifi would constantly drop and force me to reboot the modem.
The Motorola works exactly as it needs to. Setup was easy, my speed is being reported at 60-65(I think I pay for 50 max) and I'm yet to have any wifi issues. Wifi works perfectly with my Macbook, iPhone and the other assorted items I have connected in my home(security cameras, lights).
I'm very pleased with my decision to buy this.
Excellent modem very easy to set up and working good and fast
works good to replace my Comcast modem, freeing me of the $15 monthly charge. Virtually same range as previous Comcast modem...I was hoping for more range. I've got a very large area to cover though

I love this thing. I have tried other ones in the past and they have cut out and needed to be restarted. This does not do that. I've had it for month and have never had to restart it once. The speed is very fast and it has dual bands which is great. Yes it's a little pricey, but worth every penny.

For the money this does NOT work very well as a WIFI router. I was constantly getting wifi drops. Support say DONT use 5g - um, why did I spend money on a 2.4g/5g router when 5g DOES NOT work?
Still having drops with 2.4g band on my roku's. Too bad this is over 30 days as it WOULD have been returned!!!
Just may sell and get something reliable. I have NEVER had issues with a router like this in 10 years.

Great speeds and connections so far. Well worth the cost of replacing my substandard modem/router combo with comcast. The setup took about 10 minutes total, with a reboot as well Also, getting rid of the $10 modem/router rental fee is a big bonus.
Easy set up. Improved my signal strength throughout my House.
Might be my horrible cable provider Comcast but i didnt notice any difference in my internet.

Switched internet suppliers and decided to buy my own router. This one is boosted and supplies a very good signal thorough out the house. The previous "supplied" router had a weaker signal strength. Supports streaming video quite well.
Excellent product. Fair product support. Yes, they do answer the phone. Only 1 out of 3 or 4 product support personnel knows the advanced features, like sharing with more than 1 PC.
It's great easy installation. Now my family don't have to complaint anymore about the wifi speed.
Dank

Great. Time Warner / Spectrum 100mbps plan, I am getting download speeds of 115+ on my computer directly connected and 115+ on my cell phone with the 5ghz wireless. 11 ping plugged in direct, 32 ping over WiFi. The wifi capability really surprised me. Took 10-15 mins to activate, most of the time on hold, very easy process. Amazon shipping was terrible, it looked like someone took it off the shelf, Saran wrapped it, and put a shipping label on it. At least the modem/router still works.

Great router/cable combo. I bought it solely for it's wireless capacity and I'm more than happy with the purchase. I have it in my small one bed apt and it works flawlessly. I even get a wifi connection while I'm in my parking lot. This makes streaming games a breeze, extremely happy with the purchase.
Well built and worked great - easy set-up to all my computer platforms!

This is supposed to be Xfinity ready, however it does not have phone support, so I still had to rent the Xfinity modem. Was a waste of money for my purpose. Have not even opened the package as a result.

Fast!! Doesn't drop my wifi connection. I'm able to stream and connect all my devices in my home with ease without any dropped connections. Setup is easy. Now I just wish my ISP was better.. Worth every penny and saves me those annoying rental fees. Works better than the rented Cox modem/routers.
I replaced my modern provided by Cox and got a major boost in speed with both wifi and Ethernet connections.
Love it. Way faster than our last cable modem we had. Wifi is great, handles our 9+ devices on the network with no problem. Doesn't drop the signal like our last one did.
Best purchase ever
Works perfectly. Used all the time.
So far so good. No issues after one week of use with Comcast internet.
Works great.
Easy to set up. Truthfully, no issue whatsoever. It works well, it's steady in performance and does what it is supposed to do.
Excellent product. Hookup was easy. Activation went smoothly. Using setup to change username/password was quick. Paying for 200/20 and consistently getting 235/23 with Time Warner (Spectrum).

Buy this modem if you are having connection issues!!!!! I have Comcast and I started having ping and latency spikes constantly after they "upgraded" my modem. Their new duel band modem is straight garbage. They sent out 4 different technicians that couldn't solve the problem, then I plug this modem in and BOOM instant perfect connection.
Easy install, all in 1 box. Wifi works great. Easy password, and easy to set up. Highly recommend. No issues at all so far.
Great modem and router. Great range. Strong and CONSISTENT connection!

Changing over to new modem and Install was a breeze. I'm currently on xfinity's 25mb plus 200 speed boost plan. I used to run xfinity's most current modem but could never get really decent speeds especially with the WiFi even woth tweaking settings the bestbi could. I used to average 20-60mbps down which is decent but not good enough for me. With the current setup, I'm getting 200+ consistently. First pic is on PC hardwired, the 2nd is on wifi on my phone, and 3rd is on my older ps4 hardwired. I'm assuming the ps4 is getting slower speeds due to the 100ft cat cable and it's also sharing the line with the home security camera system. I'm satisfied!

Stay away of this modem:
* I get disconnections all the time.
* I can't get full speed on wireless (I have 200mb connection, sometimes it give less than 100mb).
* I can't get more than 10mbs on local network (should give 100). All the cables are cat6 and cat 7.
* You cannot have a control of upgrading the firmware - they control the upgrades for you.
* I keep seeing some unidentified IP (hostname is "Static IP") connected to the router. I added it to the Mac address filtering - but it is still there. Doesn't look like the modem is really secure enough...
Update:
----------
It gets even worse than I thought: I was told by XFinity that they can update my modem remotely. without my permission. This is unbelievable and unprecedented in terms of privacy. I am not sure how Motorola and Xfinity got to this deal. But it raises big privacy concerns.

products.name: Motorola 16x4 High-Speed Cable Gateway with WiFi, 686 Mbps DOCSIS 3.0 modem + AC1600 Wi-Fi Gigabit Router, Certified by Comcast, Charter Spectrum, Time Warner Cable, More, MG7540

detail.comments: Drops connection constantly. Management console only accessible via linux. Windows 10 keeps all my three browsers timing out. Could not set an alternative DNS because connectivity would drop within 20 minutes. Notes: ISPs can now sell your browsing habits (big bro is watching). Firmware updates to router only from ISP as needed, per hard reboot. Changing my DNS to 8.8.8.8 ... had router disconnecting constantly (I have Astound/Wave cable). You must configure wireless for optimal speed per motorola website (sucks out of the box). Chaining another router requires DMZ or MAC pass-through. I am giving this device another week.
Only downside is that it doesn't have a button to push and easily connect devices, you have to manually enter the password.....more secure, but mildly annoying.
A VERY QUICK AND EASY SYART AND VER FAST FROM MY MODEM ROUTER, LESS CABLE CLUTTER

This is highly unreliable. I'm not a computer programmer and did follow the instruction manual to try and get it to work properly but it does not. Unfortunately I decided it wasn't worth trying anymore after the cut off return date.

Seems to work good. I replaced the comcast rental router with this one and it works the same. The 2.4 ghz band seems a little weaker to me, but the 5 is working great. I have full coverage in my 2 story 2200 Square ft house, with the modem being placed in a closet.
Came in quickly and meets expectations. Working well so far. Admin tools easy to access and easy to work with.

I can't recommend this product for anyone with a Firestick or Wemo. I tried it out for a month and for some reason my Amazon Firestick on 2.5GHz / 5GHz would not stay connected to the device for more then 30 minutes. I would play Netflix / HBO GO shows / movies and it would die in the middle and needed to reconnect. I thought it was first just the Firestick but I have several Wemo's that were having the same periodic issues. I would loose connection and would have to hard restart the devices to get them to reconnect. I don't think it was my devices. I had no problems with my hardwired pc or my cell phones on this thing. I did not have time to troubleshoot this and ended up switching to a Arris cable modem only and a Nighthawk X4 wireless modem.
Best router I've ever used! Very fast, faster than my rental thanks guy 👍

Noticeably faster speeds! This item was extremely easy to setup and activate. All you need to do is insert the cables provided, tighten the coaxial cord, and call your internet service provider. I've gone through a few different modems/routers, and this was by far the easiest to install. You can go to the domain and customize name/password for the connection. There is also the 5G WiFi signal, for compatible devices. All devices connected, and have had no issues with dropping signal. The price is great compared to similar modem+WiFi router combos!
Great modem combo. I only pay for 75 Mbps, but with this modem I constantly get readings from speedtest around 90 Mbps.
Fine speed (on Cox) when if feels like working, but has to be rebooted multiple times per day on the "good" days. There are far better options out there despite Amazon's "recommended" tag.
easy to set, called comcast and they had this modem/router activated in less than a minute!
The Best!

Well worth the money! This modem/router out performed my TWC Arris modem/router. The wireless 5GHz signal is strong all throughout the house. I'm getting 230Mbps+ download on my android phone, and 300Mbps+ on LAN lines. But don't expect to see these yourself unless you have the correct service and setup.
This was easy to set-up and worked well right away. I am very happy!

great modem/ router, both 2.4 and 5 channels provide great wifi coverage in my house. The modem is connected to Comcast network. The setup is easy and takes about 5-10 minutes for the basic configuration. The UI is simple and intuitive.
love Motorola, reliable brand reliable quality! Works great!
great modem/ router, fas tshipping would use again, 5 star seller
works great comcast helped set it up wouldnt have taken long but thats not the case when you deal with comcast

It was easy to setup. Took me 5 minutes with my ISP Wow. The WiFi connection is great through out my whole house (upstairs/downstairs). The only reason I gave it four stars was because the power cord is very short. Had to do some rearranging of my power strip to accommodate it. Probably needs to be twice as long. Would buy this product again in a second.
To slow for I7 system
